intro: Airopsis praecox, commonly known as the early sea holly, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cichorioideae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of blue-green leaves and produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. This plant is typically found in coastal areas and saline soils, adapting well to harsh environments. It has a short growing season and is often seen as a pioneer species in disturbed habitats. The plant's structure and growth habits make it an important component of maritime ecosystems.
